title: Chapter 8: Non-Combat Actions

quote.quote: Sometimes a battle has to be won before the fighting begins.....sometimes you just want to know what's behind door number 2.
quote.author: Mykaela Morrow, Expert Thief

intro: The following chart depicts the typical Difficulty: threshold for passing a Test. These are not hard and fast rules, but provide a guideline for how to determine successes and failures.

content.name: Lockpicking
content: The ability to open locks without the proper key.
Requires a lockpick. A basic lockpick can be any sort of thin metal object that can fit into the keyhole. Specialized lockpicks may provide a bonus.

content.name: Stealth
content: All players can slip into stealth, with a test, so long as no enemies are directly engaged with them or gazing at them.

While in stealth, stealth tests are done if someone is looking for your character or if you are doing an action that could catch a character’s attention (pickpocketing, trying to sneak up on them, slipping by them, etc).

content.name: Pickpocketing
content: You can attempt to pick your target’s pocket from stealth/unnoticed.

content.name: Crafting
content: Used for crafting and fixing things.

content.name: Attribute Tests
content: Most often, the action you need to take will be based purely on your attributes. Maybe you just wish to scout out a room with an awareness check, maybe you're just trying to talk someone into giving you information with a charm check, or maybe you're trying to move some heavy boxes with a strength test.
If there is something you wish to do, just ask the DM. They'll tell you to roll a test, if needed, against a specific attribute.
